item.title: Ancient Maritime Discovery: 3,000-Year-Old Shipwreck Reveals Lost Civilization
item.description: Marine archaeologists have uncovered a remarkable Bronze Age shipwreck off the Mediterranean coast, containing perfectly preserved artifacts that challenge our understanding of ancient trade routes. The vessel, discovered at a depth of 60 meters, carried precious cargo including gold jewelry, ceramic vessels, and mysterious bronze tablets inscribed with an unknown script. Initial carbon dating confirms the ship dates back 3,000 years, making it one of the oldest intact vessels ever found. The discovery suggests advanced navigation techniques and extensive maritime networks existed far earlier than previously believed, potentially rewriting chapters of ancient history.
item.media:keywords: archaeology, shipwreck, ancient civilization, maritime history, Bronze Age
item.dc:creator: Maritime Archaeology Journal
item.dc:subject: Archaeological Discovery
